original_title: Only One Hacker At The Keyboard? Amateurs!
original_content:
We imagine many of you have seen the ridiculous scene from the TV series NCIS in which a network intrusion is combated by two people working at the same keyboard at once. Its become a meme in our community, and its certainly quite funny.  But could there be a little truth behind the unintentional joke? [Tedu] presents some possibilities, and theyre not all either far-fetched or without application.
The first is called Duelmon, and its a split-screen process and network monitor worthy of two players, while the second is Mirrorkeys, a keyboard splitter which uses the Windows keys as modifiers to supply the missing half. As they say, the ability to use both at once would be the mark of the truly 1337.
Meanwhile here at Hackaday were evidently closer to 1336.5, as our pieces are written by single writers alone at the keyboard. We would be fascinated to see whether readers could name any other potential weapons in the dual-hacker arsenal though, and wed like to remind you that as always, the comments are open below.
The intense hacking scene from NCIS can be found below the break. Be warned though, it contains the trauma of seeing a computer unplugged without shutting down first.
title: 「NCISから学ぶ：2人のハッカーが同じキーボードでネットワーク侵入を撃退？」
body: NCISのネットワーク侵入のシーンが笑いの種になっているが、2人が同時にキーボードを操作することは可能かもしれない。2つの可能性、DuelmonとMirrorkeysについて紹介されている。NCISのハッキングシーンも動画で見られる。
titles: 「NCISから学ぶ：2人のハッカーが同じキーボードでネットワーク侵入を撃退？」
「Duelmon：2人のプレイヤーにふさわしい分割画面プロセスとネットワークモニター」
「Mirrorkeys：キーボード分割装置で半分不足分を補完」
「ハッカーの武器：同時に2つのタスクをこなす方法を考える」
「NCISのハッキングシーン：パソコンのシャットダウンなしに抜く場面含む」
